title._content: [George Fisher Baker house, Tuxedo Park, New York. (LOC)

description._content: Johnston, Frances Benjamin,, 1864-1952,, photographer. [George Fisher Baker house, Tuxedo Park, New York. Iris at Tuxedo Lake] [ca. 1913] 1 photograph : glass lantern slide, hand-colored ; 3.25 x 4 in. Notes: Site History. House Architecture: James Brown Lord, 1887 for Pierre Lorillard, acquired by George Fisher Baker in 1895. Landscape: Clarence Fowler, circa 1912. Today: House but not garden extant. On slide (handwritten): "B" and "Baker, Geo. F., Tuxedo." Also, yellow-gold star sticker and red hollow circle. Photographed when Frances Benjamin Johnston and Mattie Edwards Hewitt worked together. Title, date, and subject information provided by Sam Watters, 2011. Forms part of: Garden and historic house lecture series in the Frances Benjamin Johnston Collection (Library of Congress). Rights Info: No known restrictions on publication. Repository: Library of Congress, Prints and Photographs Division, Washington, D.C. 20540 USA, hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/pp.print Higher resolution image is available (Persistent URL): hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/ppmsca.16763 Call Number: LC-J717-X108- 36
